<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Velora Meteor Impact Simulator</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/font-awesome/6.4.0/css/all.min.css">
    <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/jspdf/2.5.1/jspdf.umd.min.js"></script>
    <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/three.js/r128/three.min.js"></script>
    <script src="https://unpkg.com/leaflet@1.7.1/dist/leaflet.js"></script>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://unpkg.com/leaflet@1.7.1/dist/leaflet.css" />
    <style>
        * {
            margin: 0;
            padding: 0;
            box-sizing: border-box;
            font-family: 'Segoe UI', Tahoma, Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif;
        }

        body {
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, #0b1a30 0%, #152642 100%);
            color: #e0f2ff;
            min-height: 100vh;
            overflow-x: hidden;
        }

        .container {
            max-width: 1200px;
            margin: 0 auto;
            padding: 20px;
        }

        header {
            text-align: center;
            padding: 20px 0;
            margin-bottom: 30px;
            border-bottom: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1);
        }

        h1 {
            font-size: 2.5rem;
            margin-bottom: 10px;
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ff9d00, #ff2e00);
              -webkit-background-clip: text;
              background-clip: text;
            -webkit-text-fill-color: transparent;
            text-shadow: 0 2px 10px rgba(255, 157, 0, 0.3);
        }

        .subtitle {
            color: #a0c8ff;
            font-size: 1.2rem;
            margin-bottom: 20px;
        }

        .nav-tabs {
            display: flex;
            justify-content: center;
            flex-wrap: wrap;
            gap: 10px;
            margin-bottom: 30px;
        }

        .tab {
            padding: 12px 24px;
            background: rgba(30, 45, 70, 0.7);
            border-radius: 30px;
            cursor: pointer;
            transition: all 0.3s ease;
            border: 1px solid rgba(100, 150, 255, 0.2);
        }

        .tab:hover {
            background: rgba(50, 80, 140, 0.8);
            transform: translateY(-2px);
            box-shadow: 0 5px 15px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);
        }

        .tab.active {
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ff7b00, #ff4d00);
            color: white;
            box-shadow: 0 5px 15px rgba(255, 123, 0, 0.4);
        }

        .tab-content {
            display: none;
            animation: fadeIn 0.5s ease;
        }

        .tab-content.active {
            display: block;
        }

        @keyframes fadeIn {
            from { opacity: 0; transform: translateY(10px); }
            to { opacity: 1; transform: translateY(0); }
        }

        .card {
            background: rgba(20, 35, 60, 0.6);
            border-radius: 15px;
            padding: 25px;
            margin-bottom: 25px;
            box-shadow: 0 10px 30px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);
            border: 1px solid rgba(100, 150, 255, 0.1);
            backdrop-filter: blur(10px);
        }

        .card-title {
            font-size: 1.5rem;
            margin-bottom: 15px;
            color: #ff9d00;
            display: flex;
            align-items: center;
            gap: 10px;
        }

        .solar-system {
            display: flex;
            justify-content: space-between;
            flex-wrap: wrap;
            gap: 20px;
            margin-bottom: 30px;
        }

        .planet {
            width: 120px;
            height: 120px;
            border-radius: 50%;
            display: flex;
            flex-direction: column;
            align-items: center;
            justify-content: center;
            cursor: pointer;
            transition: all 0.3s ease;
            position: relative;
            box-shadow: 0 0 20px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1);
            overflow: hidden;
        }

        .planet-image {
            width: 100%;
            height: 100%;
            object-fit: cover;
            border-radius: 50%;
            background: #1a2a4a;
        }

        .planet:hover {
            transform: scale(1.1);
            box-shadow: 0 0 30px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2);
        }

        .planet-info {
            position: absolute;
            bottom: -40px;
            background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.7);
            padding: 5px 10px;
            border-radius: 10px;
            font-size: 0.9rem;
            opacity: 0;
            transition: opacity 0.3s ease;
        }

        .planet:hover .planet-info {
            opacity: 1;
        }

        .simulator-controls {
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr;
            gap: 20px;
            margin-bottom: 30px;
        }

        .control-group {
            background: rgba(30, 45, 70, 0.5);
            padding: 20px;
            border-radius: 15px;
        }

        select, button, input {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 12px;
            margin: 10px 0;
            background: rgba(20, 35, 60, 0.8);
            border: 1px solid rgba(100, 150, 255, 0.3);
            border-radius: 8px;
            color: white;
            font-size: 1rem;
        }

        button {
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ff7b00, #ff4d00);
            cursor: pointer;
            transition: all 0.3s ease;
            font-weight: bold;
        }

        button:hover {
            transform: translateY(-2px);
            box-shadow: 0 5px 15px rgba(255, 123, 0, 0.4);
        }

        .visualization {
            height: 300px;
            background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);
            border-radius: 15px;
            display: flex;
            justify-content: center;
            align-items: center;
            margin-bottom: 30px;
            overflow: hidden;
            position: relative;
        }

        .planet-visual {
            width: 150px;
            height: 150px;
            border-radius: 50%;
            position: relative;
            box-shadow: 0 0 30px rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1);
        }

        .meteor {
            position: absolute;
            width: 10px;
            height: 10px;
            background: linear-gradient(45deg, #ff9d00, #ff2e00);
            border-radius: 50%;
            top: -20px;
            box-shadow: 0 0 10px #ff2e00;
        }

        .impact-effect {
            position: absolute;
            width: 30px;
            height: 30px;
            border-radius: 50%;
            background: radial-gradient(circle, #ff2e00 0%, rgba(255, 46, 0, 0) 70%);
            opacity: 0;
        }

        .data-grid {
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(250px, 1fr));
            gap: 20px;
        }

        .data-item {
            background: rgba(30, 45, 70, 0.5);
            padding: 15px;
            border-radius: 10px;
            text-align: center;
        }

        .data-value {
            font-size: 1.8rem;
            font-weight: bold;
            color: #ff9d00;
            margin: 10px 0;
        }

        .research-cards {
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(300px, 1fr));
            gap: 20px;
        }

        .research-card {
            background: rgba(30, 45, 70, 0.5);
            padding: 20px;
            border-radius: 15px;
            transition: all 0.3s ease;
            cursor: pointer;
        }

        .research-card:hover {
            transform: translateY(-5px);
            box-shadow: 0 10px 25px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
        }

        footer {
            text-align: center;
            padding: 20px 0;
            margin-top: 40px;
            border-top: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1);
            color: #a0c8ff;
        }

        /* Planet Info Modal */
        .modal {
            display: none;
            position: fixed;
            top: 0;
            left: 0;
            width: 100%;
            height: 100%;
            background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.8);
            z-index: 1000;
            justify-content: center;
            align-items: center;
        }

        .modal-content {
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, #152642 0%, #0b1a30 100%);
            border-radius: 15px;
            padding: 30px;
            width: 90%;
            max-width: 800px;
            max-height: 80vh;
            overflow-y: auto;
            box-shadow: 0 0 50px rgba(255, 157, 0, 0.5);
            border: 1px solid rgba(255, 157, 0, 0.3);
            position: relative;
        }

        .close-modal {
            position: absolute;
            top: 15px;
            right: 15px;
            font-size: 1.5rem;
            cursor: pointer;
            color: #ff9d00;
        }

        .planet-details {
            display: flex;
            flex-direction: column;
            gap: 20px;
        }

        .planet-header {
            display: flex;
            align-items: center;
            gap: 20px;
            margin-bottom: 20px;
        }

        .planet-image-large {
            width: 150px;
            height: 150px;
            border-radius: 50%;
            box-shadow: 0 0 30px rgba(255, 157, 0, 0.5);
            object-fit: cover;
        }

        .planet-name {
            font-size: 2.5rem;
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ff9d00, #ff2e00);
          -webkit-background-clip: text;
              background-clip: text;
             -webkit-text-fill-color: transparent;
        }

        .planet-description {
            line-height: 1.6;
        }

        /* Detailed Results */
        .detailed-results {
            margin-top: 20px;
            padding: 20px;
            background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);
            border-radius: 10px;
        }

        .result-item {
            margin-bottom: 15px;
            padding-bottom: 15px;
            border-bottom: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1);
        }

        .result-label {
            font-weight: bold;
            color: #ff9d00;
            margin-right: 10px;
        }

        .action-buttons {
            display: flex;
            gap: 15px;
            margin-top: 20px;
        }

        .action-buttons button {
            flex: 1;
        }

        .secondary-btn {
            background: linear-gradient(90deg, #3a7ca5, #1f4e6e) !important;
        }

        /* Historical Event Visualization */
        .event-visualization {
            height: 200px;
            background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);
            border-radius: 10px;
            margin: 20px 0;
            position: relative;
            overflow: hidden;
        }

        /* Game Styles */
.game-container {
    width: 100%;
    height: 500px;
    border-radius: 15px;
    overflow: hidden;
    position: relative;
    border: 1px solid rgba(100, 150, 255, 0.2);
    background: linear-gradient(135deg, #0b1a30 0%, #152642 100%);
}

#game-canvas {
    width: 100%;
    height: 100%;
    display: block;
}

.game-ui {
    position: absolute;
    top: 10px;
    left: 0;
    width: 100%;
    display: flex;
    justify-content: space-between;
    padding: 0 20px;
    color: white;
    font-size: 18px;
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 2px rgba(0,0,0,0.8);
}

.timer, .asteroids-count {
    background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5);
    padding: 5px 10px;
    border-radius: 5px;
}

.game-status {
    background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5);
    padding: 5px 10px;
    border-radius: 5px;
    font-weight: bold;
}

.asteroid {
    position: absolute;
    border-radius: 50%;
    cursor: pointer;
    transition: transform 0.2s;
}

.asteroid:hover {
    transform: scale(1.1);
}

.asteroid.exploding {
    animation: explode 0.5s forwards;
}

@keyframes explode {
    0% {
        transform: scale(1);
        opacity: 1;
    }
    50% {
        transform: scale(1.5);
        opacity: 0.7;
    }
    100% {
        transform: scale(0);
        opacity: 0;
    }
}

.earth {
    position: absolute;
    bottom: 20px;
    left: 50%;
    transform: translateX(-50%);
    width: 80px;
    height: 80px;
    border-radius: 50%;
    background: linear-gradient(135deg, #3a7ca5, #2a5c7a);
    box-shadow: 0 0 20px rgba(100, 150, 255, 0.5);
}

        /* Map Container */
        .map-container {
            height: 400px;
            border-radius: 10px;
            overflow: hidden;
            margin: 20px 0;
        }

        /* 3D Visualization */
        .visualization-3d {
            height: 400px;
            border-radius: 10px;
            overflow: hidden;
            margin: 20px 0;
            position: relative;
        }

        /* Slider Styles */
        .slider-container {
            margin: 15px 0;
        }

        .slider-label {
            display: flex;
            justify-content: space-between;
            margin-bottom: 5px;
        }

        .slider-value {
            color: #ff9d00;
            font-weight: bold;
        }

        input[type="range"] {
            appearance: none;
            -webkit-appearance: none;
            width: 100%;
            height: 8px;
            border-radius: 5px;
            background: rgba(100, 150, 255, 0.2);
            outline: none;
        }

        input[type="range"]::-webkit-slider-thumb {
            -webkit-appearance: none;
            appearance: none;
            width: 20px;
            height: 20px;
            border-radius: 50%;
            background: #ff9d00;
            cursor: pointer;
            box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(255, 157, 0, 0.5);
        }

        input[type="range"]::-moz-range-thumb {
            width: 20px;
            height: 20px;
            border-radius: 50%;
            background: #ff9d00;
            cursor: pointer;
            box-shadow: 0 0 10px rgba(255, 157, 0, 0.5);
        }

        /* Tooltip */
        .tooltip {
            position: relative;
            display: inline-block;
            border-bottom: 1px dotted #ff9d00;
            cursor: help;
        }

        .tooltip .tooltiptext {
            visibility: hidden;
            width: 200px;
            background-color: rgba(20, 35, 60, 0.9);
            color: #fff;
            text-align: center;
            border-radius: 6px;
            padding: 10px;
            position: absolute;
            z-index: 1;
            bottom: 125%;
            left: 50%;
            margin-left: -100px;
            opacity: 0;
            transition: opacity 0.3s;
            font-size: 0.9rem;
            line-height: 1.4;
        }

        .tooltip:hover .tooltiptext {
            visibility: visible;
            opacity: 1;
        }

        /* Trajectory Canvas */
        .trajectory-canvas {
            width: 100%;
            height: 400px;
            border-radius: 10px;
            background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.3);
            margin: 20px 0;
        }

        /* Impactor 2025 Styles */
        .impactor-timeline {
            display: flex;
            flex-direction: column;
            gap: 20px;
            margin: 20px 0;
        }

        .timeline-item {
            background: rgba(30, 45, 70, 0.5);
            padding: 15px;
            border-radius: 10px;
            border-left: 4px solid #ff9d00;
        }

        .timeline-date {
            font-weight: bold;
            color: #ff9d00;
            margin-bottom: 5px;
        }

        /* Asteroid Risk Factors */
        .risk-factors {
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(200px, 1fr));
            gap: 15px;
            margin: 20px 0;
        }

        .risk-factor {
            background: rgba(30, 45, 70, 0.5);
            padding: 15px;
            border-radius: 10px;
            text-align: center;
        }

        .risk-level {
            font-size: 1.5rem;
            font-weight: bold;
            margin: 10px 0;
        }

        .risk-high { color: #ff4d00; }
        .risk-medium { color: #ff9d00; }
        .risk-low { color: #4caf50; }

        @media (max-width: 768px) {
            .simulator-controls {
                grid-template-columns: 1fr;
            }
            
            .solar-system {
                justify-content: center;
            }
            
            .planet {
                width: 100px;
                height: 100px;
            }
            
            .planet-header {
                flex-direction: column;
                text-align: center;
            }
            
            .action-buttons {
                flex-direction: column;
            }
            
            .game-container {
                height: 400px;
            }
            /* Damage Assessment Styles */
.damage-assessment {
    margin-top: 20px;
    padding: 20px;
    background: rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.1);
    border-radius: 10px;
    border-left: 4px solid #ff2e00;
}

.damage-category {
    margin-bottom: 15px;
    padding: 15px;
    background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.05);
    border-radius: 8px;
}

.damage-category h4 {
    color: #ff9d00;
    margin-bottom: 10px;
    display: flex;
    align-items: center;
    gap: 8px;
}

.damage-item {
    display: flex;
    justify-content: space-between;
    margin: 8px 0;
    padding: 5px 0;
    border-bottom: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1);
}

.damage-label {
    font-weight: bold;
    color: #a0c8ff;
}

.damage-value {
    color: #ff9d00;
    font-weight: bold;
}

.severity-indicator {
    display: inline-block;
    width: 12px;
    height: 12px;
    border-radius: 50%;
    margin-right: 8px;
}

.severity-low { background-color: #4CAF50; }
.severity-medium { background-color: #FF9800; }
.severity-high { background-color: #F44336; }
.severity-extreme { background-color: #9C27B0; }
        }
        /* Real-Time Asteroids Styles */
.asteroid-item {
    background: rgba(30, 45, 70, 0.5);
    padding: 15px;
    margin: 10px 0;
    border-radius: 10px;
    border-left: 4px solid #ff9d00;
    cursor: pointer;
    transition: all 0.3s ease;
}

.asteroid-item:hover {
    background: rgba(50, 70, 100, 0.6);
    transform: translateX(5px);
}

.asteroid-item.hazardous {
    border-left-color: #ff4d00;
    background: rgba(70, 30, 30, 0.5);
}

.asteroid-name {
    font-weight: bold;
    color: #ff9d00;
    margin-bottom: 5px;
}

.asteroid-details {
    display: grid;
    grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr;
    gap: 10px;
    margin-top: 10px;
}

.asteroid-detail {
    font-size: 0.9rem;
}

.detail-label {
    color: #a0c8ff;
    font-weight: bold;
}

.api-loading {
    color: #ff9d00;
}

.api-error {
    color: #ff4d00;
}

.api-success {
    color: #4caf50;
}

/* Asteroid markers on map */
.asteroid-marker {
    background: #ff9d00;
    border: 2px solid white;
    border-radius: 50%;
    width: 12px;
    height: 12px;
}

.hazardous-marker {
    background: #ff4d00;
    border: 2px solid #ff9d00;
    animation: pulse 2s infinite;
}

@keyframes pulse {
    0% { transform: scale(1); }
    50% { transform: scale(1.2); }
    100% { transform: scale(1); }
}
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <div class="container">
        <header>
            <h1><i class="fas fa-meteor"></i> Velora Meteor Impact Simulator</h1>
            <p class="subtitle">Explore planets, simulate meteor impacts, analyze the research, and enjoy the impact game.</p>
        </header>

        <div class="nav-tabs">
            <div class="tab active" data-tab="solar">Solar System</div> 
           <div class="tab " data-tab="dashboard">Dashboard</div>
            <div class="tab" data-tab="simulator">Impact Simulator</div>
            <div class="tab" data-tab="impactor">Impactor 2025</div>
             <div class="tab" data-tab="meteors">Meteors & Asteroids</div>
            <div class="tab" data-tab="realtime">Real-Time Asteroids</div>
            <div class="tab" data-tab="trajectory">Asteroid Trajectory</div>
            <div class="tab" data-tab="nasa">NASA Missions</div>
            <div class="tab" data-tab="defense">Planetary Defense</div>
            <div class="tab" data-tab="visualization">3D Visualization</div>
            <div class="tab" data-tab="map">Impact Map</div>
              <div class="tab" data-tab="education">Educational Resources</div>
            <div class="tab" data-tab="game">Impact Game</div>
        </div>

        <!-- Dashboard Tab -->
        <div class="tab-content" id="dashboard">
            <div class="card">
                <h2 class="card-title"><i class="fas fa-chart-line"></i> Meteor Activity Dashboard</h2>
                <p>Real-time monitoring of meteor activity in our solar system.</p>
                
                <div class="data-grid">
                    <div class="data-item">
                        <h3>Near Earth Objects</h3>
                        <div class="data-value" id="neo-count">Loading...</div>
                        <p>Currently tracked by NASA</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="data-item">
                        <h3>Potentially Hazardous</h3>
                        <div class="data-value" id="hazardous-count">Loading...</div>
                        <p>Objects with potential impact risk</p>
                    </div>
                    <div class="data-item">
                        <h3>Next Close Approach</h3>
                        <div class="data-value" id="next-approach">Loading...</div>
                        <p>Days until next close approach</p>
                    </div>
                </div>
                
                <button id="refresh-data"><i class="fas fa-sync-alt"></i> Refresh Data</button>
            </div>
            
            <div class="card">
                <h2 class="card-title"><i class="fas fa-satellite"></i> Recent Asteroid Data</h2>
                <div id="asteroid-data">
                    <p>Loading asteroid data from NASA API...</p>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
<!-- Real-Time Asteroids Tab -->
<div class="tab-content" id="realtime">
    <div class="card">
        <h2 class="card-title"><i class="fas fa-satellite"></i> Real-Time Asteroid Tracker</h2>
        <p>Track near-Earth asteroids using NASA's real-time data and simulate potential impacts.</p>
        
        <div class="simulator-controls">
            <div class="control-group">
                <h3>Search Parameters</h3>
                <div class="slider-container">
                    <div class="slider-label">
                        <span>Days Ahead: <span class="slider-value" id="days-value">7</span> days</span>
                    </div>
                    <input type="range" id="days-slider" min="1" max="30" value="7" step="1">
                </div>
                
                <label style="display: flex; align-items: center; margin: 15px 0;">
                    <input type="checkbox" id="hazardous-only" style="width: auto; margin-right: 10px;">
                    Potentially Hazardous Only
                </label>
                
                <button id="fetch-asteroids">
                    <i class="fas fa-sync-alt"></i> Fetch Asteroid Data
                </button>
            </div>
            
            <div class="control-group">
                <h3>Filter Results</h3>
                <select id="sort-by">
                    <option value="miss_distance">Closest Approach</option>
                    <option value="velocity">Fastest Velocity</option>
                    <option value="size">Largest Size</option>
                    <option value="hazardous">Most Hazardous</option>
                </select>
                
                <div class="slider-container">
                    <div class="slider-label">
                        <span>Min Diameter: <span class="slider-value" id="min-diameter-value">0.1</span> km</span>
                    </div>
                    <input type="range" id="min-diameter-slider" min="0.01" max="5" value="0.1" step="0.01">
                </div>
                
                <div id="api-status" style="margin-top: 15px; padding: 10px; background: rgba(0,0,0,0.3); border-radius: 5px;">
                    <i class="fas fa-circle" style="color: #4caf50;"></i> Ready to fetch data
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>

    <div class="card">
        <h2 class="card-title"><i class="fas fa-list"></i> Near-Earth Objects</h2>

<!-- NASA Mission Tab -->
        <div class="tab-content" id="nasa">
            <div class="card">
                <h2 class="card-title">NASA’s NEO Surveyor Mission</h2>
                <p class="small-muted">NASA's upcoming Near-Earth Object (NEO) Surveyor mission is the cornerstone of its planetary defense program, designed to detect, track, and characterize potentially hazardous asteroids (PHAs) and comets.</p>
                <p class="small-muted">Ground-based telescopes are limited by daylight, weather, and solar glare. NEO Surveyor overcomes these challenges by operating as a dedicated infrared space telescope, able to detect dark asteroids that reflect little visible light. Congress directed NASA to find 90% of all NEOs larger than 140 m, and NEO Surveyor is built to achieve this mandate.</p>
                <p class="small-muted">Launch Date: <strong>No earlier than September 2027</strong> | Type: Infrared Space Telescope | Location: Sun-Earth L1 Lagrange point | Target: Asteroids, Comets</p>
                <p class="small-muted"><a href="https://science.nasa.gov/mission/neo-surveyor/">NASA Science — NEO Surveyor</a></p>
            </div>
            <div class="card">
                <h2 class="card-title">Mission Objectives</h2>
                <ul class="small-muted">
                    <li>Discover and track the majority of NEOs ≥140 m in diameter.</li>
                    <li>Find at least two-thirds of these within its 5-year mission, aiming to reach the congressional 90% mandate.</li>
                    <li>Characterize size, shape, and thermal properties for accurate risk assessment.</li>
                    <li>Operate from L1 halo orbit for unobstructed infrared observations.</li>
                </ul>
                <p class="small-muted"><a href="https://www.jpl.nasa.gov/missions/near-earth-object-surveyor/">JPL — NEO Surveyor Mission</a></p>
            </div>
            <div class="card">
                <h2 class="card-title">Instrumentation</h2>
                <p class="small-muted">The heart of NEO Surveyor is its 50 cm infrared telescope. Infrared detection enables discovery of dark, carbon-rich asteroids invisible to optical telescopes. Infrared measurements also provide more accurate asteroid sizes.</p>
                <ul class="small-muted">
                    <li>Two infrared channels: 4.5–7 μm (midwave) and 6–10 μm (longwave).</li>
                    <li>Detectors: Four H2RG 2048×2048 Sensor Chip Assemblies.</li>
                    <li>Cooling: Passively cooled to −243 °C at L1 to avoid interference from spacecraft heat.</li>
                </ul>
                <p class="small-muted"><a href="https://lasp.colorado.edu/missions/neo-surveyor/">LASP — NEO Surveyor</a> | <a href="https://repository.arizona.edu/bitstream/handle/10150/674465/121911V.pdf">Arizona Research Paper</a></p>
            </div>
        <div class="card">
                <h2 class="card-title">Potentially Hazardous Asteroids (PHAs)</h2>
                <p class="small-muted">Definition: A PHA is a Near-Earth Asteroid ≥140 m with a Minimum Orbit Intersection Distance (MOID) &lt;0.05 AU (~7.5 million km). They are large enough to cause regional devastation.</p>
                <p class="small-muted">NEAs are grouped into Atira, Aten, Apollo, and Amor classes, based on perihelion distance, aphelion distance, and semi-major axis.</p>
                <p class="small-muted"><a href="https://cneos.jpl.nasa.gov/about/basics.html">NASA CNEOS — NEO Basics</a> | <a href="https://rubinobservatory.org/education/educators/investigations/hazardous-asteroids/teacher-guide/background">Rubin Observatory — Hazardous Asteroids</a></p>
            </div>
            <div class="card">
                <h2 class="card-title">NASA’s DART Mission</h2>
                <p class="small-muted">Purpose: To test whether a spacecraft can alter an asteroid’s path using kinetic impact technology.</p>
                <p class="small-muted">Method: In 2022, NASA’s DART spacecraft deliberately struck the asteroid moonlet Dimorphos, successfully changing its orbit.</p>
                <p class="small-muted">Significance: Confirmed that asteroid deflection is possible, providing critical data for future planetary defense strategies.</p>
                <p class="small-muted"><a href="https://science.nasa.gov/planetary-defense-dart/">NASA Science — DART</a></p>
            </div>
            <div class="card">
                <h2 class="card-title">Relationship with NEO Surveyor</h2>
                <p class="small-muted">DART and NEO Surveyor are complementary. NEO Surveyor identifies and characterizes hazardous asteroids, while DART demonstrates that such threats can be mitigated. Together, they form the foundation of NASA’s planetary defense strategy.</p>
            </div>
            <div class="card">
                <h2 class="card-title">Our View</h2>
                <p class="small-muted">The NEO Surveyor mission represents a paradigm shift in planetary defense. It is the essential first step: <strong>finding the threat</strong>. By providing decades or centuries of lead time, it gives humanity the ability to prepare mitigation missions such as kinetic impactors, gravity tractors, or other technologies.</p>
                <p class="small-muted">The comprehensive catalog of PHAs will allow NASA’s Center for Near-Earth Object Studies (CNEOS) to assess impact risk and ensure early response to genuine threats. In this way, NEO Surveyor is not just a telescope — it is Earth’s early warning system against cosmic hazards.</p>
            </div>
        </div>

<!-- Meteors & Asteroids Tab -->
  <div class="tab-content" id="meteors">
    <div class="card">
      <h2 class="card-title"><i class="fas fa-comet"></i> Origin & Nature</h2>
      <div class="grid">
        <div class="planet-brief">
         <p class="small-muted">Asteroids are rocky, airless remnants from the early solar system (~4.6 billion years old). Most lie in the main asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter. Sizes range from under 10 m to &gt;500 km. Their combined mass is less than Earth's Moon.</p>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>

    <div class="card">
      <h2 class="card-title"><i class="fas fa-asterisk"></i> Notable Asteroids</h2>
      <div class="grid">

        <div class="planet-brief">
          <h3>Ceres</h3>
          <p class="small-muted">Discovered 1801; reclassified as a dwarf planet in 2006. Likely contains subsurface water ice.</p>
        </div>

        <div class="planet-brief">
            <h3>Pallas</h3>
          <p class="small-muted">Large primitive asteroid (~512 km). Not clearly differentiated.</p>
        </div>

        <div class="planet-brief">
         <h3>Juno</h3>
          <p class="small-muted">Silicate-rich asteroid; third discovered (1804).</p>
        </div>

        <div class="planet-brief">
        <h3>Vesta</h3>
          <p class="small-muted">Differentiated protoplanet with a core, mantle, and crust. Source of HED meteorites (~530 km diameter).</p>
        </div>

        <div class="planet-brief">
          <h3>Eros</h3>
          <p class="small-muted">Near-Earth asteroid; first NEA orbited and landed on by NASA’s NEAR Shoemaker (2000–2001).</p>

        </div>

        <div class="planet-brief">

          <p class="small-muted">Primitive, carbon-rich NEA; samples returned by NASA's OSIRIS‑REx (sample returned 2023).</p>
        </div>

        <div class="planet-brief">
          <h3>Ryugu</h3>
          <p class="small-muted">Carbonaceous rubble-pile NEA; samples returned by JAXA Hayabusa2 (2020).</p>
        </div>

        <div class="planet-brief">
        <h3>Psyche</h3>
          <p class="small-muted">Metallic asteroid; may be an exposed protoplanet core. Target of NASA's Psyche mission (~2029).</p>
        </div>

        <div class="planet-brief">
         <h3>Apophis</h3>
          <p class="small-muted">NEA in the Aten group. Will make a very close approach on April 13, 2029 (~32,000 km). No significant impact risk per current analyses.</p>
        </div>

      </ul>
      <h3 style="margin-top:10px">Monitoring & Definitions</h3>

        // Switch to simulator with selected planet
        function switchToSimulator(planet) {
            document.querySelectorAll('.tab').forEach(t => t.classList.remove('active'));

            document.querySelector('[data-tab="simulator"]').classList.add('active');
            document.getElementById('simulator').classList.add('active');
            
            document.getElementById('planet-select').value = planet;

                    document.querySelectorAll('.tab').forEach(t => t.classList.remove('active'));
                    document.querySelectorAll('.tab-content').forEach(c => c.classList.remove('active'));
                    
                    // Add active class to clicked tab and corresponding content
                    tab.classList.add('active');
                    document.getElementById(tab.dataset.tab).classList.add('active');
                    
                    // Initialize specific tab content if needed
                    if (tab.dataset.tab === 'map') {
                        initMap();
                    } else if (tab.dataset.tab === 'visualization') {
                        init3DVisualization();
                    } else if (tab.dataset.tab === 'game') {
                        initGame();

                        initTrajectorySimulator();

        // Format scientific notation for display
        function formatScientific(value) {
            const num = parseFloat(value);
            if (num >= 1e12) return (num / 1e12).toFixed(0) + 'e12';
            if (num >= 1e9) return (num / 1e9).toFixed(0) + 'e9';
            return num.toExponential(0);
        }

        // Update deflection parameters based on selected strategy
        function updateDeflectionParams() {
            const strategy = document.getElementById('deflection-strategy').value;
            const paramsContainer = document.getElementById('deflection-params');
            
            let paramsHTML = '';
            
            switch(strategy) {
                case 'kinetic':
                    paramsHTML = `

                        <div class="slider-container">

                        <div class="slider-container">

                        </div>
                    `;
                    break;
                case 'nuclear':
                    paramsHTML = `
                        <h3>Nuclear Explosive Parameters</h3>
                        <div class="slider-container">
                            <div class="slider-label">
                                <span>Yield: <span class="slider-value" id="nuclear-yield-value">1</span> megaton</span>
                            </div>

                            </div>

                        </div>
                    `;
                    break;
                case 'laser':
                    paramsHTML = `

                            </div>
                            <input type="range" id="laser-power-slider" min="1" max="100" value="10" step="1">
                        </div>
                        <div class="slider-container">

                            </div>
                            <input type="range" id="laser-duration-slider" min="0.1" max="10" value="1" step="0.1">
                        </div>
                    `;
                    break;
                case 'solar':
                    paramsHTML = `
                        <h3>Solar Sail Parameters</h3>
                        <div class="slider-container">
                            <div class="slider-label">
                                <span>Sail Area: <span class="slider-value" id="sail-area-value">1000</span> m²</span>
                            </div>
                            <input type="range" id="sail-area-slider" min="100" max="10000" value="1000" step="100">
                        </div>
                        <div class="slider-container">

        // Simulate impact function
        function simulateImpact() {
            const planet = document.getElementById('planet-select').value;
            const diameter = parseInt(document.getElementById('diameter-slider').value);
            const velocity = parseInt(document.getElementById('velocity-slider').value);
            const type = document.getElementById('type-select').value;
            const angle = parseInt(document.getElementById('angle-slider').value);
            const location = document.getElementById('location-select').value;
            
            // Update planet visual
            updatePlanetVisual(planet);
            
            // Show meteor and animate impact
            const meteor = document.getElementById('meteor');
            const impactEffect = document.getElementById('impact-effect');
            const resultsDiv = document.getElementById('simulation-results');
            
            meteor.style.display = 'block';
            meteor.style.left = Math.random() * 140 + 'px';
            
            // Animate meteor falling
            let position = -20;
            const fall = setInterval(() => {
                position += 2;
                meteor.style.top = position + 'px';
                
                if (position >= 70) {
                    clearInterval(fall);
                    meteor.style.display = 'none';
                    impactEffect.style.display = 'block';
                    impactEffect.style.left = meteor.style.left;
                    impactEffect.style.top = meteor.style.top;
                    
                    // Animate impact effect
                    let scale = 1;
                    const expand = setInterval(() => {
                        scale += 0.5;
                        impactEffect.style.transform = `scale(${scale})`;
                        impactEffect.style.opacity = 1 - (scale / 10);
                        
                        if (scale >= 10) {
                            clearInterval(expand);
                            impactEffect.style.display = 'none';
                            
                            // Show results
                            showImpactResults(planet, diameter, velocity, type, angle, location);
                        }
                    }, 50);
                }
            }, 20);
        }

        // Show detailed impact results
function showImpactResults(planet, diameter, velocity, type, angle, location) {
    // Calculate impact energy (0.5 * mass * velocity^2)
    // For simplicity, we'll use average density based on type
    const densities = {
        stony: 3000, // kg/m³
        iron: 8000,  // kg/m³
        cometary: 1000 // kg/m³
    };
    
    const density = densities[type] || 3000;
    const radius = diameter / 2; // meters
    const volume = (4/3) * Math.PI * Math.pow(radius, 3); // m³
    const mass = density * volume; // kg
    const energyJoules = 0.5 * mass * Math.pow(velocity * 1000, 2); // Joules
    
    // Convert to megatons of TNT (1 megaton = 4.184e15 J)
    const energyMegatons = energyJoules / 4.184e15;
    
    // Calculate crater size (simplified scaling law)
    const craterDiameter = 0.0001 * Math.pow(energyMegatons, 0.294) * 1000; // km
    const craterDepth = craterDiameter * 0.2; // km
    
    // Calculate seismic magnitude (simplified)
    const seismicMagnitude = 0.67 * Math.log10(energyMegatons * 1e6) + 5.87;
    
    // Calculate tsunami height if ocean impact
    let tsunamiHeight = 0;
    if (location === 'ocean' || location === 'coastal') {
        tsunamiHeight = 0.5 * Math.pow(energyMegatons, 0.5); // meters
    }
    
    // Determine impact effects based on parameters
    let resultText = '';
    if (energyMegatons < 0.001) {
        resultText = 'The meteor burns up in the atmosphere with no surface impact.';
    } else if (energyMegatons < 1) {
        resultText = 'The meteor creates a small crater with local blast effects.';
    } else if (energyMegatons < 100) {
        resultText = 'The meteor causes significant regional destruction.';
    } else if (energyMegatons < 10000) {
        resultText = 'The meteor causes continental-scale effects.';
    } else {
        resultText = 'The meteor causes global climate effects and potential mass extinction.';
    }
    
    // Calculate damage assessment (ONLY FOR EARTH)
    let damageAssessmentHTML = '';
    if (planet === 'earth') {
        const damageData = calculateEarthDamages(energyMegatons, diameter, location, type);
        damageAssessmentHTML = generateDamageAssessmentHTML(damageData);
    }
    
    // Store simulation data for report generation
    currentSimulationData = {
        planet,
        diameter,
        velocity,
        type,
        angle,
        location,
        energyMegatons,
        craterDiameter,
        craterDepth,
        seismicMagnitude,
        tsunamiHeight,
        resultText,
        timestamp: new Date().toLocaleString(),
        damages: planet === 'earth' ? calculateEarthDamages(energyMegatons, diameter, location, type) : null
    };
    
    // Display results
    document.getElementById('simulation-results').innerHTML = `
        <h3>Simulation Results</h3>
        <p>${resultText}</p>
         <a href="https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/19i7tKJph0636Vb_NiZsA9DVlX-8UPWQo" target="_blank">For detailed simulation click here</a></p>
        <div class="detailed-results">
            <h4>Detailed Impact Report</h4>
            <div class="result-item">
                <span class="result-label">Impact Energy:</span> ${energyMegatons.toFixed(2)} megatons of TNT
            </div>
            <div class="result-item">
                <span class="result-label">Crater Diameter:</span> ${craterDiameter.toFixed(2)} km
            </div>
            <div class="result-item">
                <span class="result-label">Crater Depth:</span> ${craterDepth.toFixed(2)} km
            </div>
            <div class="result-item">
                <span class="result-label">Seismic Magnitude:</span> ${seismicMagnitude.toFixed(1)}
            </div>
            ${tsunamiHeight > 0 ? `
            <div class="result-item">
                <span class="result-label">Tsunami Height:</span> ${tsunamiHeight.toFixed(1)} meters
            </div>
            ` : ''}
        </div>
        
        ${damageAssessmentHTML}
        
        <div class="data-grid">
            <div class="data-item">
                <h3>Crater Diameter</h3>
                <div class="data-value">${craterDiameter.toFixed(2)} km</div>
            </div>
            <div class="data-item">
                <h3>Energy Released</h3>
                <div class="data-value">${energyMegatons.toFixed(2)} MT</div>
            </div>
            <div class="data-item">
                <h3>Seismic Magnitude</h3>
                <div class="data-value">${seismicMagnitude.toFixed(1)}</div>
            </div>
        </div>
    `;
    
    // Show action buttons
    document.getElementById('action-buttons').style.display = 'flex';
    
    // Update impact map if on map tab
    if (document.getElementById('map').classList.contains('active')) {
        updateImpactMap(currentSimulationData);
    }
    // Calculate Earth-specific damages
function calculateEarthDamages(energyMegatons, diameter, location, type) {
    // Base calculations on energy and location
    let fatalities = 0;
    let injuries = 0;
    let economicDamage = 0;
    let severity = 'low';
    
    // Calculate affected area (simplified)
    const blastRadius = Math.pow(energyMegatons, 0.33) * 10; // km
    const thermalRadius = blastRadius * 2;
    const seismicRadius = blastRadius * 5;
    
    // Population density factors (people per km²)
    const densityFactors = {
        land: 50, // Average global population density
        coastal: 200, // Higher density in coastal areas
        ocean: 10 // Lower for ocean, but tsunami affects coasts
    };
    
    const density = densityFactors[location] || 50;
    
    // Calculate casualties based on energy and location
    if (energyMegatons < 0.001) {
        fatalities = 0;
        injuries = Math.floor(Math.random() * 100);
        economicDamage = energyMegatons * 1e6; // $1M per 0.001 MT
        severity = 'low';
    } else if (energyMegatons < 1) {
        // Small impact: local effects
        fatalities = Math.floor(energyMegatons * density * 10);
        injuries = fatalities * 3;
        economicDamage = energyMegatons * 1e9; // $1B per MT
        severity = 'medium';
    } else if (energyMegatons < 100) {
        // Medium impact: regional effects
        fatalities = Math.floor(energyMegatons * density * 100);
        injuries = fatalities * 5;
        economicDamage = energyMegatons * 1e10; // $10B per MT
        severity = 'high';
    } else {
        // Large impact: continental/global effects
        fatalities = Math.floor(energyMegatons * density * 1000);
        injuries = fatalities * 10;
        economicDamage = energyMegatons * 1e12; // $1T per MT
        severity = 'extreme';
    }
    
    // Adjust for location-specific factors
    if (location === 'ocean') {
        // Tsunami effects on coastal populations
        fatalities *= 0.3; // Fewer immediate fatalities
        injuries *= 0.7;
        economicDamage *= 2; // Higher infrastructure damage from tsunami
    } else if (location === 'coastal') {
        // Combined effects
        fatalities *= 1.5;
        injuries *= 1.3;
        economicDamage *= 1.8;
    }
    
    // Adjust for meteor type
    if (type === 'iron') {
        // Iron meteors penetrate deeper, more seismic effects
        economicDamage *= 1.2;
    } else if (type === 'cometary') {
        // Cometary fragments may airburst, wider blast radius
        fatalities *= 1.1;
        injuries *= 1.2;
    }
    
    return {
        fatalities: Math.round(fatalities),
        injuries: Math.round(injuries),
        economicDamage: economicDamage,
        severity: severity,
        blastRadius: blastRadius.toFixed(1),
        thermalRadius: thermalRadius.toFixed(1),
        seismicRadius: seismicRadius.toFixed(1),
        affectedArea: (Math.PI * Math.pow(blastRadius, 2)).toFixed(0)
    };
}

// Generate HTML for damage assessment
function generateDamageAssessmentHTML(damageData) {
    const severityLabels = {
        low: 'Low',
        medium: 'Medium', 
        high: 'High',
        extreme: 'Extreme'
    };
    
    const severityColors = {

        medium: '#FF9800',
        high: '#F44336',
        extreme: '#9C27B0'
    };
    
    // Format economic damage
    let economicDamageFormatted;
    if (damageData.economicDamage >= 1e12) {
        economicDamageFormatted = `$${(damageData.economicDamage / 1e12).toFixed(2)} trillion`;
    } else if (damageData.economicDamage >= 1e9) {
        economicDamageFormatted = `$${(damageData.economicDamage / 1e9).toFixed(2)} billion`;
    } else if (damageData.economicDamage >= 1e6) {
        economicDamageFormatted = `$${(damageData.economicDamage / 1e6).toFixed(2)} million`;
    } else {
        economicDamageFormatted = `$${damageData.economicDamage.toLocaleString()}`;
    }
    
    return `
        <div class="damage-assessment">
            <h3><i class="fas fa-exclamation-triangle"></i> Earth Impact Damage Assessment</h3>
            
            <div class="damage-category">
                <h4>
                    <span class="severity-indicator severity-${damageData.severity}"></span>
                    Overall Severity: ${severityLabels[damageData.severity]}
                </h4>
                
                <div class="damage-item">
                    <span class="damage-label">Estimated Fatalities:</span>
                    <span class="damage-value">${damageData.fatalities.toLocaleString()}</span>
                </div>
                
                <div class="damage-item">
                    <span class="damage-label">Estimated Injuries:</span>
                    <span class="damage-value">${damageData.injuries.toLocaleString()}</span>
                </div>
                
                <div class="damage-item">
                    <span class="damage-label">Economic Damage:</span>
                    <span class="damage-value">${economicDamageFormatted}</span>
                </div>
            </div>
            
            <div class="damage-category">
                <h4><i class="fas fa-ruler-combined"></i> Impact Zone</h4>
                
                <div class="damage-item">
                    <span class="damage-label">Blast Radius:</span>
                    <span class="damage-value">${damageData.blastRadius} km</span>
                </div>
                
                <div class="damage-item">
                    <span class="damage-label">Thermal Effect Radius:</span>
                    <span class="damage-value">${damageData.thermalRadius} km</span>
                </div>
                
                <div class="damage-item">
                    <span class="damage-label">Seismic Effect Radius:</span>
                    <span class="damage-value">${damageData.seismicRadius} km</span>
                </div>
                
                <div class="damage-item">
                    <span class="damage-label">Total Affected Area:</span>
                    <span class="damage-value">${damageData.affectedArea} km²</span>
                </div>
            </div>
            
            <div style="margin-top: 15px; padding: 10px; background: rgba(255,255,255,0.05); border-radius: 5px; font-size: 0.9em;">
                <i class="fas fa-info-circle"></i> 
                <strong>Note:</strong> These estimates are based on simplified models and average population densities. 
                Actual impacts would vary based on specific impact location, time of day, and local infrastructure.
            </div>
        </div>
    `;
}
}
    

        // Simulate deflection
        function simulateDeflection() {
            const strategy = document.getElementById('deflection-strategy').value;
            const asteroidDiameter = parseInt(document.getElementById('defense-diameter-slider').value);
            const timeToImpact = parseInt(document.getElementById('time-slider').value);
            
            // Get strategy-specific parameters
            let deflectionSuccess = 0;
            let deflectionDistance = 0;
            let notes = '';
            
            switch(strategy) {
                case 'kinetic':
                    const impactorMass = parseInt(document.getElementById('impactor-mass-slider').value);
                    const impactorVelocity = parseInt(document.getElementById('impactor-velocity-slider').value);
                    
                    // Simplified deflection calculation
                    deflectionSuccess = Math.min(0.9, (impactorMass * impactorVelocity) / (asteroidDiameter * timeToImpact) * 100);
                    deflectionDistance = (impactorMass * impactorVelocity * timeToImpact * 365 * 24 * 3600) / (1e10);
                    notes = 'Kinetic impactors work best with long lead times and precise targeting.';
                    break;
                    
                case 'gravity':
                    const tractorMass = parseInt(document.getElementById('tractor-mass-slider').value);
                    const tractorDistance = parseInt(document.getElementById('tractor-distance-slider').value);
                    
                    deflectionSuccess = Math.min(0.8, (tractorMass / tractorDistance) * timeToImpact / 100);
                    deflectionDistance = (tractorMass * timeToImpact * 365 * 24 * 3600) / (tractorDistance * 1e9);
                    notes = 'Gravity tractors require long durations but are very precise.';
                    break;
                    
                case 'nuclear':
                    const nuclearYield = parseFloat(document.getElementById('nuclear-yield-slider').value);
                    const nuclearDistance = parseInt(document.getElementById('nuclear-distance-slider').value);
                    
                    deflectionSuccess = Math.min(0.95, (nuclearYield * 10) / nuclearDistance);
                    deflectionDistance = (nuclearYield * 1e6 * timeToImpact * 365 * 24 * 3600) / (1e12);
                    notes = 'Nuclear deflection is effective but has political and safety concerns.';
                    break;
                    
                case 'laser':
                    const laserPower = parseInt(document.getElementById('laser-power-slider').value);
                    const laserDuration = parseFloat(document.getElementById('laser-duration-slider').value);
                    
                    deflectionSuccess = Math.min(0.7, (laserPower * laserDuration) / (asteroidDiameter * 10));
                    deflectionDistance = (laserPower * 1e6 * laserDuration * 365 * 24 * 3600) / (1e11);
                    notes = 'Laser ablation works best on smaller asteroids with long lead times.';
                    break;
                    
                case 'solar':
                    const sailArea = parseInt(document.getElementById('sail-area-slider').value);
                    const sailDuration = parseInt(document.getElementById('sail-duration-slider').value);
                    
                    deflectionSuccess = Math.min(0.6, (sailArea * sailDuration) / (asteroidDiameter * 100));
                    deflectionDistance = (sailArea * 0.0001 * sailDuration * 365 * 24 * 3600) / (1e8);
                    notes = 'Solar sails require very long lead times but are fuel-free.';
                    break;
            }
            
            // Store deflection data
            currentDeflectionData = {
                strategy,
                asteroidDiameter,
                timeToImpact,
                deflectionSuccess: Math.round(deflectionSuccess * 100),
                deflectionDistance: deflectionDistance.toFixed(2),
                notes,
                timestamp: new Date().toLocaleString()
            };
            
            // Display results
            document.getElementById('deflection-results').innerHTML = `
                <h3>Deflection Simulation Results</h3>
                <div class="data-grid">
                    <div class="data-item">
                        <h3>Success Probability</h3>
                        <div class="data-value">${currentDeflectionData.deflectionSuccess}%</div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="data-item">
                        <h3>Deflection Distance</h3>
                        <div class="data-value">${currentDeflectionData.deflectionDistance} km</div>
                    </div>
                </div>
                <div class="detailed-results">
                    <p><strong>Notes:</strong> ${currentDeflectionData.notes}</p>
                    <p>This simulation assumes ideal conditions. Real-world effectiveness may vary based on asteroid composition, rotation, and other factors.</p>
                </div>
            `;
        }

        // Run scenario
        function runScenario(scenario) {
            // Set parameters based on scenario
            switch(scenario) {
                case 'impactor2025':
                    // Impactor 2025 scenario
                    document.getElementById('planet-select').value = 'earth';
                    document.getElementById('diameter-slider').value = 500;
                    document.getElementById('diameter-value').textContent = '500';
                    document.getElementById('velocity-slider').value = 15;
                    document.getElementById('velocity-value').textContent = '15';
                    document.getElementById('type-select').value = 'stony';
                    document.getElementById('angle-slider').value = 45;
                    document.getElementById('angle-value').textContent = '45';
                    document.getElementById('location-select').value = 'ocean';
                    
                    // Switch to simulator tab
                    switchToTab('simulator');
                    break;
                    
                case 'chicxulub':
                    // Chicxulub impact scenario
                    document.getElementById('planet-select').value = 'earth';
                    document.getElementById('diameter-slider').value = 10000;
                    document.getElementById('diameter-value').textContent = '10000';
                    document.getElementById('velocity-slider').value = 20;
                    document.getElementById('velocity-value').textContent = '20';
                    document.getElementById('type-select').value = 'stony';
                    document.getElementById('angle-slider').value = 30;
                    document.getElementById('angle-value').textContent = '30';
                    document.getElementById('location-select').value = 'coastal';
                    
                    // Switch to simulator tab
                    switchToTab('simulator');
                    break;
                    
                case 'tunguska':
                    // Tunguska event scenario
                    document.getElementById('planet-select').value = 'earth';
                    document.getElementById('diameter-slider').value = 50;
                    document.getElementById('diameter-value').textContent = '50';
                    document.getElementById('velocity-slider').value = 15;
                    document.getElementById('velocity-value').textContent = '15';
                    document.getElementById('type-select').value = 'stony';
                    document.getElementById('angle-slider').value = 90;
                    document.getElementById('angle-value').textContent = '90';
                    document.getElementById('location-select').value = 'land';
                    
                    // Switch to simulator tab
                    switchToTab('simulator');
                    break;
                    
                case 'custom':
                    // Custom scenario - prompt user for parameters
                    alert('Set your custom parameters in the simulator controls, then click "Simulate Impact".');
                    switchToTab('simulator');
                    break;
            }
            
            // Update scenario results display
            document.getElementById('scenario-results').innerHTML = `
                <h3>${scenario.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + scenario.slice(1)} Scenario</h3>
                <p>Parameters have been set. Click "Simulate Impact" to run the simulation.</p>
            `;
        }

// Initialize trajectory simulator
        function initTrajectorySimulator() {
            const canvas = document.getElementById('trajectory-canvas');
            const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
            
            // Set canvas size
            canvas.width = canvas.parentElement.clientWidth;
            canvas.height = 400;
            
            // Initial draw
            updateTrajectory();
        }

        // Update trajectory visualization
        function updateTrajectory() {
            const canvas = document.getElementById('trajectory-canvas');
            const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
            
            // Clear canvas
            ctx.fillStyle = '#0b1a30';
            ctx.fillRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);
            
            // Get current parameters
            const velocity = parseInt(document.getElementById('trajectory-velocity-slider').value);
            const angle = parseInt(document.getElementById('trajectory-angle-slider').value);
            const mass = parseFloat(document.getElementById('trajectory-mass-slider').value);
            const eccentricity = parseFloat(document.getElementById('trajectory-eccentricity-slider').value);
            const inclination = parseInt(document.getElementById('trajectory-inclination-slider').value);
            const axis = parseFloat(document.getElementById('trajectory-axis-slider').value);
            
            // Calculate trajectory parameters
            const closestApproach = (0.05 + (1 - eccentricity) * 0.1).toFixed(3) + ' AU';
            const impactProbability = (eccentricity * 5).toFixed(1) + '%';
            const relativeVelocity = velocity + ' km/s';
            
            // Update display values
            document.getElementById('closest-approach').textContent = closestApproach;
            document.getElementById('impact-probability').textContent = impactProbability;
            document.getElementById('relative-velocity').textContent = relativeVelocity;
            
            // Draw Sun at center
            ctx.beginPath();
            ctx.arc(canvas.width / 2, canvas.height / 2, 20, 0, Math.PI * 2);
            ctx.fillStyle = '#ff9d00';
            ctx.fill();
            
            // Draw Earth orbit
            ctx.beginPath();
            ctx.arc(canvas.width / 2, canvas.height / 2, 100, 0, Math.PI * 2);
            ctx.strokeStyle = '#3a7ca5';
            ctx.stroke();
            
            // Draw Earth
            ctx.beginPath();
            ctx.arc(canvas.width / 2, canvas.height / 2 - 100, 10, 0, Math.PI * 2);
            ctx.fillStyle = '#3a7ca5';
            ctx.fill();
            
            // Draw asteroid trajectory (elliptical orbit)
            const centerX = canvas.width / 2;
            const centerY = canvas.height / 2;
            const semiMajor = 150 * axis;
            const semiMinor = semiMajor * Math.sqrt(1 - Math.pow(eccentricity, 2));
            
            ctx.beginPath();
            ctx.ellipse(centerX, centerY, semiMajor, semiMinor, inclination * Math.PI / 180, 0, Math.PI * 2);
            ctx.strokeStyle = '#ff4d00';
            ctx.stroke();
            
            // Draw asteroid
            const asteroidX = centerX + semiMajor * Math.cos(angle * Math.PI / 180);
            const asteroidY = centerY + semiMinor * Math.sin(angle * Math.PI / 180);
            
            ctx.beginPath();
            ctx.arc(asteroidX, asteroidY, 5, 0, Math.PI * 2);
            ctx.fillStyle = '#aaaaaa';
            ctx.fill();
            
            // Draw velocity vector
            ctx.beginPath();
            ctx.moveTo(asteroidX, asteroidY);
            ctx.lineTo(
                asteroidX + velocity * 2 * Math.cos((angle + 90) * Math.PI / 180),
                asteroidY + velocity * 2 * Math.sin((angle + 90) * Math.PI / 180)
            );
            ctx.strokeStyle = '#ff9d00';
            ctx.lineWidth = 2;
            ctx.stroke();
            
            // Draw labels
            ctx.fillStyle = '#e0f2ff';
            ctx.font = '12px Arial';
            ctx.fillText('Sun', centerX - 15, centerY + 35);
            ctx.fillText('Earth', centerX - 15, centerY - 115);
            ctx.fillText('Asteroid', asteroidX + 10, asteroidY - 10);
        }

        // Initialize map
        function initMap() {
            // Create a simple map centered on the world
            const map = L.map('impact-map').setView([20, 0], 2);
            
            // Add a tile layer (using OpenStreetMap as an example)
            L.tileLayer('https://{s}.tile.openstreetmap.org/{z}/{x}/{y}.png', {
                attribution: '© OpenStreetMap contributors'
            }).addTo(map);
            
            // Store map instance for later use
            window.impactMap = map;
        }

        // Show crater zone on map
        function showCraterZone() {
            if (!window.impactMap) return;
            
            // Clear existing overlays
            clearMap();
            
            // Add a circle representing the crater zone
            // For demonstration, we'll use a random location
            const lat = Math.random() * 180 - 90;
            const lng = Math.random() * 360 - 180;
            const craterRadius = currentSimulationData ? currentSimulationData.craterDiameter * 1000 : 50000; // meters
            
            L.circle([lat, lng], {
                color: 'red',
                fillColor: '#f03',
                fillOpacity: 0.3,
                radius: craterRadius
            }).addTo(window.impactMap).bindPopup('Crater Zone');
            
            // Center map on the crater
            window.impactMap.setView([lat, lng], 6);
        }

        // Show seismic zone on map
        function showSeismicZone() {
            if (!window.impactMap) return;
            
            // Clear existing overlays
            clearMap();
            
            // Add a circle representing the seismic zone
            // For demonstration, we'll use a random location
            const lat = Math.random() * 180 - 90;
            const lng = Math.random() * 360 - 180;
            const seismicRadius = currentSimulationData ? currentSimulationData.craterDiameter * 5000 : 250000; // meters
            
            L.circle([lat, lng], {
                color: 'orange',
                fillColor: '#ffa500',
                fillOpacity: 0.3,
                radius: seismicRadius
            }).addTo(window.impactMap).bindPopup('Seismic Zone');
            
            // Center map on the impact point
            window.impactMap.setView([lat, lng], 5);
        }

        // Show tsunami zone on map
        function showTsunamiZone() {
            if (!window.impactMap) return;
            
            // Clear existing overlays
            clearMap();
            
            // Add a circle representing the tsunami zone
            // For demonstration, we'll use a coastal location
            const lat = Math.random() * 60 - 30; // Between 30S and 30N
            const lng = Math.random() * 360 - 180;
            const tsunamiRadius = currentSimulationData ? currentSimulationData.craterDiameter * 10000 : 500000; // meters
            
            L.circle([lat, lng], {
                color: 'blue',

            }).addTo(window.impactMap).bindPopup('Tsunami Zone');
